description: Unique internal identifier for the employee used across the fleet system for linking records.
Y/N flag indicating whether the employee is inactive/terminated and should be excluded from active assignments and billing.
Employee’s Social Security Number for HR/payroll identity verification; may include placeholder values. Highly sensitive PII.
Flag indicating the employee’s labor should be billed at an outside/vendor rate rather than standard internal rate; confirm with SME.
Employee’s given name as used on HR records.
Employee’s family/surname as used on HR records.
Primary street address line for the employee’s home mailing address.
Secondary address line (apartment, suite, unit, etc.).
City for the employee’s home address.
State or province code for the employee’s home address.
Postal/ZIP code for the employee’s home address.
Area code associated with the employee’s personal/main phone number.
Personal phone number, typically stored without area code.
Extension associated with the personal/main phone number; confirm with SME.
Employee’s date of birth in YYYYMMDD format.
Employee’s sex/gender code (e.g., M/F) for HR reporting.
Employee’s ethnicity classification for HR and compliance reporting; values organization-defined.
Driver’s license number used to verify driving eligibility for fleet operations.
Issuing state/province for the driver’s license.
Expiration date of the driver’s license (YYYYMMDD).
Y/N flag indicating authorization to operate fleet vehicles.
Y/N flag indicating the employee performs mechanic/technician duties.
Employment category or job class (e.g., full-time, contractor, role designation).
Code for the employee’s primary shop/work site or billing location; likely used for labor allocation; confirm with SME.
Area code for the employee’s work phone.
Work phone number, typically stored without area code.
Work phone extension, if applicable.
Official work email address.
Area code for the employee’s mobile phone.
Mobile phone number, typically stored without area code.
Internal intercom or radio contact number; likely a short code; confirm with SME.
Employee’s beeper/pager phone number (legacy field).
Pager identifier or cap code (legacy field).
Organizational department or shop to which the employee belongs.
Name of the employee’s immediate supervisor or manager.
Date the employee joined or became eligible for a union (YYYYMMDD).
Y/N flag to hide the employee from deployment/dispatch scheduling views; confirm with SME.
Fuel card number assigned for fueling transactions and tracking; if used.
Code referencing a set of user-specific default settings/preferences in the application.
Free-text medical notes or restrictions relevant to job duties; sensitive.
Expiration date for required medical certification (e.g., DOT physical) in YYYYMMDD format.
Y/N flag indicating disability status for accommodation tracking; confirm with SME and handle as sensitive data.
Employee’s spouse/partner name for HR or benefits records.
Primary emergency contact person’s name.
Relationship of the emergency contact to the employee.
Area code for the emergency contact’s phone number.
Emergency contact phone number, typically without area code.
Extension for the emergency contact phone, if applicable.
Area code for the emergency contact’s mobile phone.
Emergency contact mobile phone number, typically without area code.
Emergency contact email address.
Employee’s original hire date (YYYYMMDD).
Employee’s job title/position as displayed in directories and reports.
Y/N flag indicating salaried compensation status.
Current hourly wage rate for the employee.
Annual base salary amount; zero if not salaried.
Application login credential (stored encrypted/hashed). Extremely sensitive; restrict access.
Y/N flag granting database/admin privileges within the application; confirm with SME.
Y/N flag indicating full system access rights.
Reference to the employee’s time zone setting (foreign key to time zone table).
Y/N flag preventing assignment as a motor pool driver.
Identifier linking to detailed notes or annotations for the employee.
Identifier for the stored profile image object; zero/blank if none.
Timestamp of last modification to this record (YYYYMMDDHHMMSS).
System-generated unique row identifier (GUID/UUID) for the record.
Incrementing revision counter used for optimistic concurrency/version tracking.
User account that last modified the record.
